sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ExactBrowser. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getHeaderTitle headerTitle} : string
    • {@link #getTopListOrder topListOrder} : sap.ui.ux3.ExactOrder (default: Select)
    • {@link #getEnableListClose enableListClose} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getListHeight listHeight} : int (default: 290)
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowTopList showTopList} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableReset enableReset} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableSave enableSave} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTopListWidth topListWidth} : int (default: 168)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAttributes attributes} : sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute[] (default)
    • {@link #getOptionsMenu optionsMenu} : sap.ui.commons.Menu
  • Events
    • {@link #event:attributeSelected attributeSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:save save} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
Attribute browse area used within the Exact pattern. The main benefit of this control is the high flexibility when large data amounts shall be displayed in the form of structured data sets with a high or low interdependency level. From lists - which can be nested according to the defined attributes - the user can choose entries and thereby trigger the display of further information, depending on the chosen entry/entries (multiple selection supported).

removeAllAttributes.!description: Removes all the controls from the aggregation attributes. Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser.

setTopListOrder.!description: Sets a new value for property topListOrder. The order how the sublists of the top level list should be displayed. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Select.

parameters.sTopListOrder: type: sap.ui.ux3.ExactOrder, description: New value for property topListOrder

getAttributes.!description: Gets content of aggregation attributes. The attributes which shall be available.

getShowTopList.!description: Gets current value of property showTopList. Whether the top list of the ExactBrowser should be shown. When the property is set to false the application must ensure to select top level attributes appropriately. Default value is true.

getOptionsMenu.!description: Gets content of aggregation optionsMenu. Menu with options. The menu can not used when the property showTopList is set to false.

getTopListOrder.!description: Gets current value of property topListOrder. The order how the sublists of the top level list should be displayed. Default value is Select.

setTitle.!description: Sets a new value for property title. Title text in the list area of the Exact Browser. The title is not shown when the property showTopList is set to false. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sTitle: type: string, description: New value for property title

setEnableListClose.!description: Sets a new value for property enableListClose. Enables the close icons of the displayed lists. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bEnableListClose: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableListClose

getTopListWidth.!description: Gets current value of property topListWidth. Specifies the width of the top list in pixels. The value must be between 70 and 500. Default value is 168.

getShowHeader.!description: Gets current value of property showHeader. Whether the header area of the ExactBrowser should be shown. Default value is false.

sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
Attribute browse area used within the Exact pattern. The main benefit of this control is the high flexibility when large data amounts shall be displayed in the form of structured data sets with a high or low interdependency level. From lists - which can be nested according to the defined attributes - the user can choose entries and thereby trigger the display of further information, depending on the chosen entry/entries (multiple selection supported).

Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.IconTabBar, sap.m.TabContainer or sap.uxap.ObjectPageLayout control.
Is the item to be used within the NavigationBar

setVisible.!description: Sets a new value for property visible. Whether the NavigationItem is currently visible. When making NavigationItems invisible at runtime it is the application's responsibility to make sure it is not the currently selected one - or to select another one in this case. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bVisible: type: boolean, description: New value for property visible

getHref.!description: Gets current value of property href. Defines the link target URL. This property is optional and should only be set when required! The use of the href property is to not only allow users to navigate in-place by left-clicking NavigationItems, but also to allow right-click and then "open in new tab" or "open in new window". As long as href is not set, an empty window will open and stay blank. But when href is set, the new window/tab will load this URL and it is the application's responsibility to display what the user expects (e.g. the Shell, with the respective NavigationItem being selected).

Constructor for a new NavigationItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. sap.ui.ux3.DataSet.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DataSet. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowToolbar showToolbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFilter showFilter} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowSearchField showSearchField} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMultiSelect multiSelect} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.ux3.DataSetItem[]
    • {@link #getViews views} : sap.ui.ux3.DataSetView[]
    • {@link #getFilter filter} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectionChanged selectionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

setOffsetRight.!description:
Moves the complete Shell away from the right window border by the given number of pixels (left border in RTL case).

So there is space for a sidebar or so outside the Shell. The CSS class 'sapUiUx3ShellOuterSideBar' provides the basic position
capabilities for the sidebar DOM element.

This feature is not public. The usage is only granted to special groups on request.

openPane.!description:
Opens the side Pane.

A valid ID of a paneBarItem must be given, so this item can be marked as selected. A "paneBarItemSelected" event is then fired as if the opening was triggered by the user by a click on the respective PaneBarItem.
This method can be called (with different IDs) even when the Pane is already open. It has then the same effect as if the user switches between PaneBarItems.

Returns 'this' to allow method chaining.

parameters.sPaneBarItemId: type: string, description: The ID of the PaneBarItem which should be marked as selected.

setContent.!description:
Replaces the existing Shell content with the given Control(-Tree). Only leads to a re-rendering of the content area (not the complete Shell).
This method may be more convenient than a series of calls to "removeContent" and "addContent", which each lead to a re-rendering of the content area (but again not of the complete Shell).

By default the old content is not destroyed and is returned by this method in an array for further usage. To avoid memory leaks, the old content should be destroyed (if not needed later), by setting the "destroyOldContent" flag or by destroying it manually later on. If "destroyOldContent" is set, an empty array is returned.

parameters.bDestroyOldContent: type: boolean, description: If set, the controls previously contained in the Shell will be destroyed, to avoid memory leaks.
parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The new Content. In this method it must be exactly one control (-tree). Use addContent() to add more control (-trees) to the main content area of the Shell.

By default, the old pane content is not destroyed and is returned by this method in an array for further usage. To avoid memory leaks, the old content should be destroyed (if not needed later), by setting the "destroyOldContent" flag or by destroying it manually later on. If "destroyOldContent" is set, an empty array is returned.

  • id of type stringThe id of the PaneBarItem to which the closed pane belonged.

parameters.mArguments: type: Map, description: The arguments to pass along with the event

getSearchField.!description: Returns the SearchField control which is used in the Search Tool.

parameters.mArguments: type: Map, description: The arguments to pass along with the event

sap.ui.ux3.Shell.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
The Ux3 GoldReflection Shell, which is an application frame with navigation capabilities. It is supposed to be added to a direct child of the BODY tag of a page and there should be no other parts of the page consuming space outside the Shell.

getApplyContentPadding.!description: Gets current value of property applyContentPadding. Whether the Shell content area should have a theme-dependent padding or not. Default value is true.

setAppTitle.!description: Sets a new value for property appTitle. The application title to appear in the left part of the header, usually a company and/or product name. appIcon and appTitle are both optional and can both be set; in this case the icon appears first. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sAppTitle: type: string, description: New value for property appTitle

setDesignType.!description: Sets a new value for property designType. Defines which design type is to be used. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Standard.

parameters.sDesignType: type: sap.ui.ux3.ShellDesignType, description: New value for property designType

setPaneWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property paneWidth. The width of the right-hand side pane in pixels. The value must be a non-negative integer. The Shell reserves the right to define a minimum width (currently 50px). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 250.

parameters.iPaneWidth: type: int, description: New value for property paneWidth

getShowFeederTool.!description: Gets current value of property showFeederTool. Whether the "Feeder" tool should be displayed or not. Default value is true.

insertContent.!description: Inserts a content into the aggregation content.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: the content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

closePane.!description:
Closes the side Pane (if open).

Returns 'this' to allow method chaining.

setLogoutButtonTooltip.!description: Sets a new value for property logoutButtonTooltip. The tooltip to be displayed for the Logout Button of the Shell. If not set, a text meaning "Logout" in the current language will be displayed. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sLogoutButtonTooltip: type: string, description: New value for property logoutButtonTooltip

insertPaneContent.!description: Inserts a paneContent into the aggregation paneContent.

parameters.oPaneContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: the paneContent to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the paneContent should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the paneContent is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the paneContent is inserted at the last position

getContent.!description: Gets content of aggregation content. The content to appear in the main canvas. Each modification of this aggregation leads to a re-rendering of the content area - but not to a re-rendering of the complete Shell.

getHeaderItems.!description: Gets content of aggregation headerItems. Controls to appear in the header next to the logout button. It is recommended to only use controls of type Button, MenuButton and TextView. The respective UI guidelines need to be enforced on a higher level.

addHeaderItem.!description: Adds some headerItem to the aggregation headerItems.

parameters.oHeaderItem: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: the headerItem to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

detachSearch.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the search event of this sap.ui.ux3.Shell. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

initializePersonalization.!description:
Experimental method! Do not use!

Makes Shell personalization available and injects the given personalization settings. This should be called before the user can do any adaptations per drag&drop or using the personalization dialog. Otherwise it may override the user's new settings.

parameters.oSettings: type: object, description: Personalization settings object

insertPaneBarItem.!description: Inserts a paneBarItem into the aggregation paneBarItems.

parameters.oPaneBarItem: type: sap.ui.core.Item, description: the paneBarItem to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the paneBarItem should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the paneBarItem is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the paneBarItem is inserted at the last position

sap.ui.ux3.Shell.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Shell. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getAppTitle appTitle} : string
    • {@link #getAppIcon appIcon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getAppIconTooltip appIconTooltip} : string
    • {@link #getShowLogoutButton showLogoutButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLogoutButtonTooltip logoutButtonTooltip} : string
    • {@link #getShowSearchTool showSearchTool} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowInspectorTool showInspectorTool} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowFeederTool showFeederTool} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowTools showTools} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowPane showPane} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeaderType headerType} : sap.ui.ux3.ShellHeaderType (default: Standard)
    • {@link #getDesignType designType} : sap.ui.ux3.ShellDesignType (default: Standard)
    • {@link #getPaneWidth paneWidth} : int (default: 250)
    • {@link #getApplyContentPadding applyContentPadding} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFullHeightContent fullHeightContent} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAllowOverlayHeaderAccess allowOverlayHeaderAccess} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getWorksetItems worksetItems} : sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem[]
    • {@link #getPaneBarItems paneBarItems} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
    • {@link #getPaneContent paneContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getToolPopups toolPopups} : sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup[]
    • {@link #getHeaderItems headerItems} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getNotificationBar notificationBar} : sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:worksetItemSelected worksetItemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:paneBarItemSelected paneBarItemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:logout logout} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:feedSubmit feedSubmit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:paneClosed paneClosed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

getSelectedWorksetItem.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association selectedWorksetItem, or null.

getFullHeightContent.!description: Gets current value of property fullHeightContent. If set to true, the content area has a defined height. This means that any content put inside can use "100%" height in CSS and will then consume all available space. However, if content is larger, scrollbars will appear at the content area of the Shell and not on window level. Default value is false.

attachFeedSubmit.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the feedSubmit event of this sap.ui.ux3.Shell. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.Shell itself. Fired when a new feed entry is submitted.

parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

sap.ui.ux3.Feed.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Feed. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getFeederThumbnailSrc feederThumbnailSrc} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getFeederSender feederSender} : string
    • {@link #getLive live} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFilterItems filterItems} : sap.ui.core.ListItem[]
    • {@link #getChunks chunks} : sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk[]
    • {@link #getToolsMenuItems toolsMenuItems} : sap.ui.commons.MenuItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:filterChange filterChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:chunkAdded chunkAdded} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:toolsItemSelected toolsItemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:toggleLive toggleLive} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

QuickView is a small popup with a short overview of a Thing. QuickView is shown when a user holds the mouse pointer over a related screen element.

getType.!description: Gets current value of property type. Thing type (mandatory) like Account, Material, Employee etc. is displayed in a header at the top part of the QuickView.

getFlagState.!description: Gets current value of property flagState. State of Flag Action Default value is false.

attachNavigate.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the navigate event of this sap.ui.ux3.QuickView. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.QuickView itself. Event is fired when a user clicks on the firstTitle link. Call the preventDefault method of the event object to cancel browser navigation.
attachNavigate.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.ux3.QuickView

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.ux3.QuickView itself
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

insertContent.!description: Inserts a content into the aggregation content.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Element, description: the content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

getFirstTitleHref.!description: Gets current value of property firstTitleHref. URI to Thing Inspector

getOpenActionEnabled.!description: Gets current value of property openActionEnabled. Open Thing action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible. Default value is true.

setFirstTitleHref.!description: Sets a new value for property firstTitleHref. URI to Thing Inspector When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sFirstTitleHref: type: string, description: New value for property firstTitleHref

getShowActionBar.!description: Gets current value of property showActionBar. Show Action Bar Default value is true.

detachActionSelected.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the actionSelected event of this sap.ui.ux3.QuickView. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

getContent.!description: Gets content of aggregation content. Body content of the QuickView

getActions.!description: Gets content of aggregation actions. Actions of a Thing

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property width. Control width as common CSS-size (px or % as unit, for example).

setFollowActionEnabled.!description: Sets a new value for property followActionEnabled. Follow action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bFollowActionEnabled: type: boolean, description: New value for property followActionEnabled

addAction.!description: Adds some action to the aggregation actions.

parameters.oAction: type: sap.ui.ux3.ThingAction, description: the action to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

getFlagActionEnabled.!description: Gets current value of property flagActionEnabled. Flag action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible. Default value is true.

sap.ui.ux3.QuickView.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new QuickView. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getType type} : string
    • {@link #getFirstTitle firstTitle} : string
    • {@link #getFirstTitleHref firstTitleHref} : string
    • {@link #getSecondTitle secondTitle} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getShowActionBar showActionBar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFollowState followState} : sap.ui.ux3.FollowActionState (default: Default)
    • {@link #getFlagState flagState} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFavoriteState favoriteState} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFavoriteActionEnabled favoriteActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUpdateActionEnabled updateActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFollowActionEnabled followActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFlagActionEnabled flagActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getOpenActionEnabled openActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Element[]
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingAction[]
    • {@link #getActionBar actionBar} : sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:actionSelected actionSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:feedSubmit feedSubmit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase#constructor sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase} can be used as well.

parameters.bFavoriteState: type: boolean, description: New value for property favoriteState

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.QuickView itself. Action is selected in Action Bar

sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Popup control.
A popup which the user can open from the Shell's tool pane. Generally, the starting point would be an icon. For this pop up, buttons can be defined with any text; therefore, it has the same purpose and similar look like any common dialog box. A ToolPopup can have any content. Depending on the application type and design, the structure of the texts and input fields can be for example form-like.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

getModal.!description: Gets current value of property modal. Specifies whether the popup is modal and blocks any user-interaction with controls in the background. Changing this property while the ToolPopup is open will not have any effect. Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time. In this case a warning will be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used. Default value is false.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup itself. This event is fired after the ToolPopup has finished its closing animation. It is called for EVERY close, regardless of whether the user has triggered the close or whether the ToolPopup was closed via API call.

sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Popup control.
A popup which the user can open from the Shell's tool pane. Generally, the starting point would be an icon. For this pop up, buttons can be defined with any text; therefore, it has the same purpose and similar look like any common dialog box. A ToolPopup can have any content. Depending on the application type and design, the structure of the texts and input fields can be for example form-like.

getAutoClose.!description: Gets current value of property autoClose. Determines whether the ToolPopup will auto close when it loses focus. If the user e.g. clicks outside of the ToolPopup it will be closed. Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time. In this case a warning will be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used. Default value is false.

sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ToolPopup. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIconHover iconHover} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIconSelected iconSelected} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getModal modal} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getInverted inverted} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAutoClose autoClose} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMaxHeight maxHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMaxWidth maxWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getOpenDuration openDuration} : int (default: 400)
    • {@link #getCloseDuration closeDuration} : int (default: 400)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getButtons buttons} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:open open} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:close close} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:enter enter} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:iconChanged iconChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:closed closed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:opened opened} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

If the ToolPopup content is higher than the ToolPopup, the content will be scrollable. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

getEnabled.!description:
Indicates whether the ToolPopup is currently enabled or not. Applications can't control the enabled state via a property. A ToolPopup is implicitly enabled depending on its openState. Descendant controls that honor the enabled state of their ancestors will appear disabled after the ToolPopup is closed. Since 1.13.1. Whether a dialog is regarded as "enabled" during the state transitions (OPENING, CLOSING) is not fully decided. Currently, it is enabled during the OPENING phase and disabled during the CLOSING phase. The only potential change would be to treat the OPENING phase as disabled as well. Applications should be prepared to receive events from "enabled" controls after they called open() on the dialog until close() is called on it. If the mentioned potential change should happen, the dialog will become enabled only after the transition to OPEN. Events from "enabled" children then can still only arrive between open() and close(), so applications that obey the previous rule should continue to work. Only end users or code that explicitly triggers pseudo user events would notice a difference.
A second aspect that might change is the visual behavior of the content: during the CLOSING phase it 'looks' enabled but in fact it is already disabled. This avoids unnecessary redraws for content that becomes hidden soon. Should this show to be confusing for end users, it might be changed.

open.!description: Opens the ToolPopup. It is checked which control wants to open the ToolPopup. The Shell was previously set as parent so the corresponding parent element is used to set the correct position of the ToolPopup. If another control (i.e. a button) opens the ToolPopup, the control must be previously set as opener via setOpener to the ToolPopup. Corresponding to this opener the position of the ToolPopup will be set. It's also possible to set the position above, below or left from the opener. This can be done via the possible parameters my and at. These parameters refers to work the same way as they do of sap.ui.core.Popup.open.

sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ActionBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getFollowState followState} : sap.ui.ux3.FollowActionState (default: Default)
    • {@link #getFlagState flagState} : boolean
    • {@link #getFavoriteState favoriteState} : boolean
    • {@link #getUpdateState updateState} : boolean
    • {@link #getThingIconURI thingIconURI} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getAlwaysShowMoreMenu alwaysShowMoreMenu} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowUpdate showUpdate} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFollow showFollow} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFlag showFlag} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFavorite showFavorite} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowOpen showOpen} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDividerWidth dividerWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getBusinessActions businessActions} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingAction[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:actionSelected actionSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:feedSubmit feedSubmit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Toolbar or sap.m.OverflowToolbar control.
A special toolbar with predefined social actions which can be shown as needed. These are: Create an update (Feed), Follow, Mark for Follow Up, Mark as Favorite and Open Thing. In addition business actions (ThingAction instances) can be added which are either displayed as MenuItems of the 'More' menu button or as individual tool bar buttons. When using this control, please be aware that it fulfills rather specific requirements: it has been designed for and is used within composite controls QuickView and ThingInspector.

Fired when any of the social action’s toolbar buttons except ‘Update’ or any of the business action’s menu items resp. buttons is pressed. Constructor for a new ThingInspector. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getFirstTitle firstTitle} : string
    • {@link #getType type} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getSecondTitle secondTitle} : string

    • {@link #getFlagState flagState} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFavoriteState favoriteState} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFavoriteActionEnabled favoriteActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUpdateActionEnabled updateActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFollowActionEnabled followActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFlagActionEnabled flagActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeaderType headerType} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewerHeaderType (default: Standard)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingAction[]
    • {@link #getHeaderContent headerContent} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup[]
    • {@link #getFacets facets} : sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem[]
    • {@link #getFacetContent facetContent} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup[]
    • {@link #getActionBar actionBar} : sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:actionSelected actionSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:facetSelected facetSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:feedSubmit feedSubmit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.ux3.Overlay#constructor sap.ui.ux3.Overlay} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewer.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ThingViewer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getType type} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getSubtitle subtitle} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeaderType headerType} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewerHeaderType (default: Standard)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getHeaderContent headerContent} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup[]
    • {@link #getFacets facets} : sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem[]
    • {@link #getFacetContent facetContent} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup[]
    • {@link #getActionBar actionBar} : sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:facetSelected facetSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getShowSubAttributesIndicator.!description: Gets current value of property showSubAttributesIndicator. Specifies whether the attribute shall have sub values for visual purposes. The indicator which is a little arrow beside an attribute in the list is computed automatically (getShowSubAttributesIndicator_Computed() of sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute). In the case that a supply function is attached, and the supplyActive attribute has value 'true', then the Exact pattern needs a hint if sub attributes are available. The showSubAttributesIndicator attribute is considered then and has to be maintained. If the back-end does not support count-calls, for example, showSubAttributesIndicator should be set to true. Default value is true.

attachSupplyAttributes.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the supplyAttributes event of this sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute itself. A supply function is a handler which is attached to the supplyAttributes event. The event is fired when the corresponding ExactAttribute is selected, it was already selected when a handler is attached or function getAttributes() is called.
attachSupplyAttributes.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute

parameters.oAdditionalData: type: object, description: New value for property additionalData

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property width. Specifies the width of the corresponding list in pixels. The value must be between 70 and 500. Default value is 168.

getListOrder.!description: Gets current value of property listOrder. The order how the sublists of this attribute should be displayed. Default value is Select.

setSupplyActive.!description: Sets a new value for property supplyActive. The supplyAttributes event is only fired if supplyActive has value true which is the default. After firing the event, the attribute is automatically set to false. The idea is that a supply function is called only once when the data is requested. To enable the event again it is possible to manually set the attribute back to true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bSupplyActive: type: boolean, description: New value for property supplyActive

Constructor for a new DataSetSimpleView. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers.     • {@link #getName name} : string (default: Name of this View)

    • {@link #getIconHovered iconHovered} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIconSelected iconSelected} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getResponsive responsive} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getItemMinWidth itemMinWidth} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getInitialItemCount initialItemCount} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getReloadItemCount reloadItemCount} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getScrollArea scrollArea} : any
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTemplate template} : sap.ui.core.Control
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

New items are loaded automatically when the user scrolls down. The number of items which are reloaded can be defined with the property "reloadItemCount" When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

getInitialItemCount.!description: Gets current value of property initialItemCount. If this value is greater zero only this amount of items is loaded in the first place. Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
DataSetSimpleView provides a simple view example for DataSet usage.

setReloadItemCount.!description: Sets a new value for property reloadItemCount. This number defines the item count which is reloaded on scroll if initialItemCount is enabled. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

handleSelection.!description: Eventhandler for the selection of an Item

destroyTemplate.!description: Destroys the template in the aggregation template.

getIconHovered.!description: Gets current value of property iconHovered. icon: hovered state

resultText.!description: A title text which is displayed above the result section

reloadItemCount.!description: This number defines the item count which is reloaded on scroll if initialItemCount is enabled.

enableComment.!description: If true the comment action is enabled.

feederThumbnailSrc.!description:
URL to the thumbnail image for the comment feeder.
This property is optional if the chunk is a sub-control of a feed control. In this case the value of the feed control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed control.

showCounter.!description: Specifies whether the counter for all entries is shown.

thingIconURI.!description: The thing icon uri. Icon will be displayed in Feeder

autoActivateSupply.!description:
If you want the supply function to be called on every select, you can set the autoActivateSupply attribute to true. In this case, supplyActive is automatically
set to true on every unselect.

appIconTooltip.!description: The tooltip of the application icon in the header

favoriteActionEnabled.!description: Favorite action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

scrollArea.!description: ID of the DOM Element or jQuery reference to the dom which holds the scrollbar for the dataset

logoutButtonTooltip.!description: The tooltip to be displayed for the Logout Button of the Shell. If not set, a text meaning "Logout" in the current language will be displayed.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

topListOrder.!description: The order how the sublists of the top level list should be displayed.

openButtonVisible.!description: Defines whether the 'Open' button shall be visible.

fitParent.!description: If set to true, control will fit parents content area

placeholderText.!description: This property could be used for costum placeholder. If it is not set, the default text is used.

href.!description:
Defines the link target URL. This property is optional and should only be set when required!
The use of the href property is to not only allow users to navigate in-place by left-clicking NavigationItems, but also to allow right-click and then "open in new tab" or "open in new window". As long as href is not set, an empty window will open and stay blank. But when href is set, the new window/tab will load this URL and it is the application's responsibility to display what the user expects (e.g. the Shell, with the respective NavigationItem being selected).

flagActionEnabled.!description: Flag action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

enableFavorite.!description: If true the favorite action is enabled.

supplyActive.!description:
The supplyAttributes event is only fired if supplyActive has value true which is the default. After firing the event, the attribute is automatically set to false.
The idea is that a supply function is called only once when the data is requested. To enable the event again it is possible to manually set the attribute back to true.

maxWidth.!description: Forces a maximum width of the ToolPopup in pixels.

sap.ui.ux3.!description: Controls that implement the SAP User Experience (UX) Guidelines 3.0

topListWidth.!description: Specifies the width of the top list in pixels. The value must be between 70 and 500.

designType.!description: Defines which design type is to be used.

showOpen.!description: Indicates whether social action “Open” is shown, default is ‘true’

sidebarVisible.!description: Defines if the list of collection items is visible on the left

showTools.!description: Whether the tool area should be displayed at all or not.

applyContentPadding.!description: Whether the Shell content area should have a theme-dependent padding or not.

showFeederTool.!description: Whether the "Feeder" tool should be displayed or not.

displaySecondaryValues.!description: Specifies whether the text values from the additionalText property (see sap.ui.core.ListItems) shall be displayed.

showFollow.!description: Indicates whether social action “Follow” is shown, default is ‘true’

enableShare.!description: If true the share action is enabled.

favorite.!description: Defines whether the entry shall be displayed as favorite. This property is not supported for comment chunks.

multiSelect.!description: Specifies whether multiple or single selection is used.

headerTitle.!description: Title text in the header of the Exact Browser.

atPosition.!description: Optional. At position defines which position on the target control to align the positioned tooltip.

dividerWidth.!description: The minimum width of ActionBar's the social actions part: business action controls have to be rendered outside this area

listHeight.!description: The height of the list area in px.

shared.!description: Defines whether the entry shall be shared. This property is not supported for comment chunks.

firstTitle.!description: First Line of the Thing Inspector Title

selectedKeys.!description: Array of type string containing the selected keys.

icon.!description:
This property is relevant for Shell use:
The URL to the icon displayed in the tool area which is used to open the ToolPopup.
The recommended size is 32x32px, including some transparent border. Therefore,
the content will cover about 20x20px.

updateActionEnabled.!description: Update action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

overflowItemsToUpperCase.!description: Sets the appearance of the menu items in the overflow menu to uppercase

appTitle.!description: The application title to appear in the left part of the header, usually a company and/or product name. appIcon and appTitle are both optional and can both be set; in this case the icon appears first.

closeDuration.!description: Time in milliseconds for the close animation.

enableListClose.!description: Enables the close icons of the displayed lists.

colspan.!description: If Group is used in a column layout the groups spans the all columns if set to true.

visibleStatus.!description: This property displays the bar corresponding to given status

maxHeight.!description:
Forces a maximum height of the ToolPopup in pixels. If the ToolPopup content
is higher than the ToolPopup, the content will be scrollable.

iconSelected.!description:
This property is relevant for Shell use:
The URL to the icon in selected state displayed in the tool area which is used to open the popup.
If no selected icon is given, the hover icon is used.

toolbarVisible.!description: Specifies whether the tool bar shall be visible

deletionAllowed.!description: Flag if the deletion of the chunk shall be allowed

enableFlag.!description: If true the flag action is enabled.

key.!description: Can be used as input for subsequent actions.

timestamp.!description: Format is ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ, Z meaning the time is in UTC time zone

showFavorite.!description: Indicates whether social action “Favorite” is shown, default is ‘true’

openDuration.!description: Time in milliseconds for the open animation.

toplevelVariant.!description: Defines whether the navigation bar shall have top-level appearance

closeButtonVisible.!description: Defines whether the 'Close' button shall be visible.

secondTitle.!description: Second Line of the Thing Inspector Title

listOrder.!description: The order how the sublists of this attribute should be displayed.

enableSave.!description: Whether the save button should be available in the header area.

enableInspect.!description: If true the inspect action is enabled.

multiSelection.!description: Allow multi selection of items in collection

fullHeightContent.!description:
If set to true, the content area has a defined height. This means that any content put inside can use "100%" height in CSS and will then consume all available space.
However, if content is larger, scrollbars will appear at the content area of the Shell and not on window level.

showSubAttributesIndicator.!description:
Specifies whether the attribute shall have sub values for visual purposes.
The indicator which is a little arrow beside an attribute in the list is computed automatically
(getShowSubAttributesIndicator_Computed() of sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute).
In the case that a supply function is attached, and the supplyActive attribute has value 'true',
then the Exact pattern needs a hint if sub attributes are available. The showSubAttributesIndicator attribute is
considered then and has to be maintained. If the back-end does not support count-calls, for example,
showSubAttributesIndicator should be set to true.

ShellPersonalization.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.36 This class was never released for productive use and will never be.
Experimental implementation of visual Ux3 Shell personalization / branding. DO NOT USE PRODUCTIVELY!!! Being completely non-generic as of now, this is supposed to facilitate discussions with Ux about the personalization capabilities. Once that concept is more final, we can go for a cleaner implementation, considering the number of configurable properties etc.

commentChunk.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.4.0 Not longer used. If a chunk is a comment is determined from hierarchy. If the parent is a chunk it's automatically a comment.
This flag changes a FeedChunk into a CommentChunk. In this case, it can not have own comments, furthermore it must be assigned to a FeedChunk.

appIcon.!description:
The URL of the image to appear in the left part of the header, usually a branding image containing a logo and/or product name. appIcon and appTitle are both optional and can both be set; in this case the icon appears first.
If the appIcon is set, for accessibility reasons the appIconTooltip must also be set.

enableReset.!description: Whether the reset functionality should be available in the header area.

showSearchTool.!description: Whether the "Global Search" tool should be displayed or not.

feederSender.!description:
Sender for the comment feeder
This property is optional if the chunk is a sub-control of a feed control. In this case the value of the feed control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed control.

iconHover.!description:
This property is relevant for Shell use:
The URL to the icon in hover state, displayed in the tool area which is used to open the popup.

additionalData.!description: An example for additional data are database keys

inverted.!description:
Specifies whether the ToolPopup has a dark or bright background. If set to true
the background and borders will be dark. If false they will be bright.
This property only has an effect for the GoldReflection-theme.

alwaysShowToggler.!description: This property defines if the toggler should be displayed the whole time when the NotificationBar is shown.

selected.!description: Specifies whether the attribute shall be selected

modal.!description:
Specifies whether the popup is modal and blocks any user-interaction with controls in the background.
Changing this property while the ToolPopup is open will not have any effect.
Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time. In this case a warning will
be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder is rendered instead of the real control

offset.!description:
Optional. Offset adds these left-top values to the calculated position.
Example: "10 3".

alwaysShowMoreMenu.!description: If true, business actions are rendered as menu items of the 'More' menu button. Otherwise, 'More' menu button is only displayed for overflow and business actions are rendered as inidividual buttons.

showLogoutButton.!description: Whether the Logoff button in the header should be displayed or not.

showInspectorTool.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.7.2 According to the current Ux designs, the ThingInspector should NOT be opened like this from the Tool Pane. And technically, the ThingInspector is not a ToolPopup. Instead trigger it from the respective elements in the Shell content.
Whether the "Inspector" tool should be displayed or not.

collision.!description: Optional. Collision - when the positioned element overflows the window in some direction, move it to an alternative position.

itemMinWidth.!description: When itemMinWidth>0 and the property floating is true the given minimum width in pixels is set to DatSet items. A minimum width must be given when the property responsive is set.

sap.ui.ux3.!helpDescription: Controls that implement the SAP User Experience (UX) Guidelines 3.0

headerType.!description: Defines which header type should be used.

paneWidth.!description: The width of the right-hand side pane in pixels. The value must be a non-negative integer. The Shell reserves the right to define a minimum width (currently 50px).

allowOverlayHeaderAccess.!description: Whether the Shell header (Title Area + Header Items) can be accessed when an Overlay, OverlayContainer or ThingInspector is open.

openActionEnabled.!description: Open Thing action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

title.!description: Determines the title displayed in the pop up window

showFlag.!description: Indicates whether social action “Mark for Follow Up” is shown, default is ‘true’

showPane.!description: Whether the pane bar should be displayed at all or not.

textDirection.!description: Options are RTL and LTR. Alternatively, an item can inherit its text direction from its parent control.

flagged.!description: Defines whether the entry is flagged. This property is not supported for comment chunks.

floating.!description: When true the DatSet items are floating containers. When set to false The Items are rendered in a 1 column Layout.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised.

visibleItemCountMode.!description: If the value is "Auto" - the Facet Filter takes the whole available height. If "Fixed" , then the default number of Facet Filter Items (5) is visible.

live.!description: Specifies whether the feed shall be in live mode

initialItemCount.!description: If this value is greater zero only this amount of items is loaded in the first place. New items are loaded automatically when the user scrolls down. The number of items which are reloaded can be defined with the property "reloadItemCount"

thumbnailSrc.!description:
URL to the thumb nail image
This property is optional if the feeder is a sub-control of a feed or a feedChunk control. In this case the value of the feed or feddChunk control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed or feedChunk control.

editable.!description: If a collection is editable an edit button will be displayed below the list of items

showHeader.!description: Whether the header area of the ExactBrowser should be shown.

resizeEnabled.!description: This property enables the bar to be resized by the user.

closeDelay.!description: Closing delay of the tooltip in milliseconds

openDelay.!description: Opening delay of the tooltip in milliseconds

responsive.!description: When true and the property floating is true the DatSet items are floating containers filling the whole space of a row.

showTopList.!description:
Whether the top list of the ExactBrowser should be shown. When the property is set to false the
application must ensure to select top level attributes appropriately.

followActionEnabled.!description: Follow action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

showUpdate.!description: Indicates whether social action “Update” is shown, default is ‘true’

autoClose.!description:
Determines whether the ToolPopup will auto close when it loses focus.
If the user e.g. clicks outside of the ToolPopup it will be closed.
Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time.
In this case a warning will be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used.

myPosition.!description: Optional. My position defines which position on the extended tooltip being positioned to align with the target control.

sap.ui.ux3.Collection.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Collection. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMultiSelection multiSelection} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectionChanged selectionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:propertyChanged propertyChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.FeedListItem control.
The unit that is embedded - single-wise or in a multiple way - into a Feed control. The control provides a set of properties for text, sender information, time stamp, comments, and functions such as flagging the entry to be favorite, shared, or flagged.

sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FeedChunk. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getThumbnailSrc thumbnailSrc} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getSender sender} : string
    • {@link #getTimestamp timestamp} : string
    • {@link #getDeletionAllowed deletionAllowed} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getCommentChunk commentChunk} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFeederThumbnailSrc feederThumbnailSrc} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getFeederSender feederSender} : string
    • {@link #getFlagged flagged} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFavorite favorite} : boolean
    • {@link #getShared shared} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableFlag enableFlag} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableShare enableShare} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableComment enableComment} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableInspect enableInspect} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableFavorite enableFavorite} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getComments comments} : sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk[]
    • {@link #getActionMenuItems actionMenuItems} : sap.ui.commons.MenuItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:deleted deleted} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:commentAdded commentAdded} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:toggleFlagged toggleFlagged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:senderClicked senderClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:referenceClicked referenceClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:toggleFavorite toggleFavorite} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:inspect inspect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:toggleShared toggleShared} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:actionItemSelected actionItemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

The NavigationBar follows the approach to use the items aggregation. If this aggregation is empty, associatedItems is used.

sap.ui.ux3.NavigationBar.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new NavigationBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getToplevelVariant toplevelVariant} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getOverflowItemsToUpperCase overflowItemsToUpperCase} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.NavigationBar.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.IconTabBar, sap.m.TabContainer or sap.uxap.ObjectPageLayout control.
Provides enhanced navigation capabilities and is the parent control of NavigationItem. It is displayed in the form of a horizontal line with switching markers depending on the currently selected item. The size of an item which is currently chosen by the user is enlarged. In the case that a large number of items are defined for the bar, this is made transparent to the user by showing symbols for scrolling options (forwards and backwards) to see the next or previous items.

getAssociatedItems.!description: Returns array of IDs of the elements which are the current targets of the association associatedItems.
